text: Logan T. Kurtz (born December 9, 1994; also known as Logan Kurtz) is an American technology consultant and advocate for Tourette Syndrome. As a Tourette Syndrome Association Youth Ambassador, he is known as an advocate for youths with Tourette Syndrome. Kurtz has also been featured on Inc., Yahoo! Finance, Business Insider, FOX and CBS. ==Early life== Kurtz was born on December 9, 1994, in Los Angeles, California. His father is an attorney and his mother is a University of Southern California Masters alumnus. Kurtz was educated at Calabasas High School." Logan Kurtz: Speaking Out About Tourette Syndrome | Calabasas, CA Patch ", patch.com. At the age of 16, in April 2010 Logan launched Definite Possibilities, a social network for people with disabilities" Teenager strives to educate peers about Tourette's Syndrome | The Acorn ", theacorn.com.. == Education and career == Kurtz attended the University of Arizona from 2013 to 2015. There, he wrote and published his first book, Royal Tips on Standing Up to a Bully as part of the Royal Tips series. Kurtz founded his first company in April 2010 at the age of 16. His first company, Definite Possibilities, was a social network for people with disabilities. He is also the founder of the technology and marketing company Wisly Marketing, which is based out of Los Angeles, California.Yahoo Finance ==See also== *Tourette Association of America ==References== ==External links== * * * Logan Kurtz at YouTube * Logan Kurtz at Facebook Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:People with Tourette syndrome Category:Disability rights activists from the United States Category:American consultants Category:American people of English descent Category:Businesspeople from Los Angeles Category:American business executives Category:21st-century American businesspeople Category:American technology company founders Category:University of Arizona alumni Category:People from Los Angeles
title: Logan T. Kurtz
